commit_message:
Fix tests repo cloning

We have a script for doing the test repo cloning, we should use
it. The script is synchronized and works well with different
branches, where the tox.ini isn't synchronized, and therefore
can lag, like it is right now, in the branch upgrades.

Change-Id: Ibb94eb78a028b28e41591c1cd9ee582a225019dc
(cherry picked from commit 571e2f661893fc498f425c5da56e28d85babd50f)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_zaqar refs/changes/88/556488/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Log config options with oslo.config

This removes some custom code inherited from Cinder which was handling
the output of secret options in a bad way. This patch utilizes Oslo's
existing utilities to output the Manila configuration options securely.

Filtering will be done with the "secret=True" option flag.

Major thanks to Eric Harney for introducing this fix to Cinder.

Change-Id: I894e011680661c0b73b9592f70a6457e403f18c6
Related-Bug: #1750074
(cherry picked from commit 3d7909deb21a1f0be4cd6eca13dc9e8d070f71e2)
(cherry picked from commit 1949b403e9feb134d0fb2b9d65271292277351ee)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/89/549989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - Use Oslo's logging features to securely output the configuration options for Manila.

commit_message:
Fix tests repo cloning

We have a script for doing the test repo cloning, we should use
it. The script is synchronized and works well with different
branches, where the tox.ini isn't synchronized, and therefore
can lag, like it is right now, in the branch upgrades.

Change-Id: Ibb94eb78a028b28e41591c1cd9ee582a225019dc

commit_message:
WIP: add new transport argument into iscsi.start_iscsi_target api

Change-Id: I75a87a43fdbbeb26b2bea73318139a239fe3555b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/88/549688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _wait_for_tgtd(attempts=10, transport='iscsi'): cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', transport, '--mode', 'target', '--op', 'show']def _start_tgtd(iqn, portal_port, device, transport): _wait_for_tgtd(transport=transport) cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', transport, '--mode', 'portal', '--op', cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', transport, '--mode', 'target', '--op', cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', transport, '--mode', 'logicalunit', '--op', cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', transport, '--mode', 'target', '--op',def _start_lio(iqn, portal_port, device, transport): portal = rtslib_fb.NetworkPortal(tpg, listen_ip, portal_port) try: if transport == 'iser': portal.iser = True except rtslib_fb.utils.RTSLibError: msg = ('Error enabling iSER for NetworkPortal: please ensure ' 'that RDMA is supported on your iSCSI port %(port)d ' 'on ip %(listen_ip)s.') % {'port': portal_port, 'ip': listen_ip} raise errors.ISCSIError(msg) portal_port=None, transport=None): if transport is None: transport = 'iscsi' if rts_root is None: _start_tgtd(iqn, portal_port, device, transport) else: _start_lio(iqn, portal_port, device, transport)
deleted_lines: def _wait_for_tgtd(attempts=10): cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', 'iscsi', '--mode', 'target', '--op', 'show']def _start_tgtd(iqn, portal_port, device): _wait_for_tgtd() cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', 'iscsi', '--mode', 'portal', '--op', cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', 'iscsi', '--mode', 'target', '--op', cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', 'iscsi', '--mode', 'logicalunit', '--op', cmd = ['tgtadm', '--lld', 'iscsi', '--mode', 'target', '--op',def _start_lio(iqn, portal_port, device): rtslib_fb.NetworkPortal(tpg, listen_ip, portal_port) portal_port=None): if rts_root is None: _start_tgtd(iqn, portal_port, device) else: _start_lio(iqn, portal_port, device)

subject: Wire up a --skip-tags parameter for overcloud upgrade run cli
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-15 12:20:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/9bd64779a25abb0565586872506b31800c77e9cd', 'message': "Wire up a --skip-tags parameter for overcloud upgrade run cli

This exposes the --skip-tags which is useful for skipping the
service validations (--skip-tags validations). The expected
format is a comma-separated string for multiple values,
though 'validations' is the only currently supported value
available in the upgrade playbooks.

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes foo
                                  --skip-tags validations

There is a related tripleo-common review at
I8544de64d3307e3dc925c1cecf2d9156e31d25a8

Change-Id: Ie7fb8d9a388c6d53a31800406b03ddb8ed426401
Depends-On: I8544de64d3307e3dc925c1cecf2d9156e31d25a8
(cherry picked from commit c73f1ed2021da6f5846f52e47d4507a49b24c0d6)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-16 12:24:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/0b4080d977c3661dde56a7b149420176f520e9ea', 'message': "Wire up a --skip-tags parameter for overcloud upgrade run cli

This exposes the --skip-tags which is useful for skipping the
service validations (--skip-tags validation). The expected
format is a comma-separated string for multiple values,
though 'validation' is the only currently supported value
available in the upgrade playbooks.

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes foo
                                  --skip-tags validations

There is a related tripleo-common review at

commit_message:
Wire up a --skip-tags parameter for overcloud upgrade run cli

This exposes the --skip-tags which is useful for skipping the
service validations (--skip-tags validation). The expected
format is a comma-separated string for multiple values,
though 'validation' and 'pre-upgrade' are the only currently
supported tags for --skip-tags in the upgrade playbooks. The
full list of tags currently used in tripleo-heat-templates
upgrade_tasks is at [0]

  openstack overcloud upgrade run --nodes foo
                                  --skip-tags validation

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/3eb0c62e47fd1635900913b7f0ebbe134b77c7ad/tools/yaml-validate.py#L167
Change-Id: Ie7fb8d9a388c6d53a31800406b03ddb8ed426401
Depends-On: I8544de64d3307e3dc925c1cecf2d9156e31d25a8
(cherry picked from commit d1c39c15c299ef3f435137d0612a8d8af5b442cc)

commit_message:
Use rhos-release role pin puddle option

Use the pin puddle option to avoid any issues caused by generic latest.

Change-Id: Ie239a5702c36c0cd67318e0423fd86551701cb36
(cherry picked from commit 84017baed9468cc102876e94779fe0f04b50cdd7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/76/555976/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support to mixed upgrade for overcloud-prep-container role.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-02 18:14:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/36045fd3385eb5eeb62d8472a674d5c9f2e2a488', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] adds the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameter in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

Because of the way we load the release file (-e ..), all those
variables have the highest precedence[3] possible and cannot be
overridden.

So this a an attempt to support that use case.  With that new variable
we can now do something like this:

    - name: Prepare for containerized deployment
      hosts: undercloud
      gather_facts: no
      tags:
        - overcloud-prep-containers
      vars:
        want_overcloud_mixed_version: mixed_version
      roles:
        - role: overcloud-prep-containers
          when: containerized_overcloud|bool or containerized_overcloud_upgrade|bool

in the toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml and have
the correct tag during deployment.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] adds the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameter in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

Because of the way we load the release file (-e ..), all those
variables have the highest precedence[3] possible and cannot be
overridden.

Furthermore we use this flag to prevent container upgrade during
initial overcloud deployment.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/

'}, {'number': 27, 'created': '2018-02-20 15:24:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/5d00142a5d6901702317abbe3294e0b4b1f35659', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] adds the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameter in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

Because of the way we load the release file (-e ..), all those
variables have the highest precedence[3] possible and cannot be
overridden.

So this a an attempt to support that use case.  With that new variable
we can now do something like this:

    - name: Prepare for containerized deployment
      hosts: undercloud
      gather_facts: no
      tags:
        - overcloud-prep-containers
      vars:
        want_overcloud_mixed_version: mixed_version
      roles:
        - role: overcloud-prep-containers
          when: containerized_overcloud|bool or containerized_overcloud_upgrade|bool

in the toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml and have
the correct tag during deployment.

Furthermore we use this flag to prevent container upgrade during
initial overcloud deployment.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348
Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

'}, {'number': 31, 'created': '2018-02-23 17:57:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/1c82c67ccc6d98a4a46f7b1839416c10f2caf448', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use this `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flags to prevent
the yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to sometime only render the container setup
script file which will be consumed by tripleo-upgrade and sometime
run it from oooq directly.  This is what `prep_container_upgrade_run`
is for.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.
Related-Bug: #1749978

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422
'}, {'number': 32, 'created': '2018-02-23 18:17:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/fc28e913273d196c4fe70d97147241330a70ab4a', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use this `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flags to prevent
the yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.

'}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2018-02-26 14:16:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/c37c4403206d64fb1fa50d1408f62f2a508eb318', 'message': 'Provide a way to change docker registry path during mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use this `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flags to prevent
the yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.
Related-Bug: #1749978

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

'}, {'number': 36, 'created': '2018-03-08 15:10:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/c39b1c739afd3d9a1956b2dc460fe1cf9bf0d727', 'message': 'Make overcloud-prep-container role support mixed upgrade.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N images files.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flag to prevent the
yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.  So we introduce
`prep_container_upgrade_run` flag that can be set from the featureset
to ensure that the container get deployed during upgrade.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.
Related-Bug: #1749978

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422
'}]
commit_message:
Add support to mixed upgrade for overcloud-prep-container role.

During mixed version upgrade, we want to deploy the overcloud with the
N-1 release docker images and then switch to the N release images
file.

That review[1] added the N-1 necessary tags.  That review[2] was an
attempt to use the proper parameters in that role for deployment in the
context of mixed version.  This fails.

The failure comes from the fact that we load the release file using
"-e ". All those variables then have the highest precedence[3]
possible and cannot be overridden.

Furthermore we use `use_overcloud_mixed_upgrade` flag to prevent the
yum upgrade to run inside container during initial overcloud
deployment.  The problem here is that the repo configuration is taken
from the undercloud which is N.  Thus the N-1 images are upgraded to
N.  That means that we can't gate "from" patches.  In a p->q setup, a
change in pike cannot be tested if it relates to the docker image.

Eventually we need a way to run the container role even when the
containerized_overcloud is false.  For Fast Forward Upgrade, the
starting point is Newton which doesn't use container.  So we introduce
`prep_container_upgrade_run` flag that can be set from the featureset
to ensure that the container get deployed during upgrade.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537833/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539920/1/toci-quickstart/playbooks/multinode-overcloud-prep.yml
[3] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/playbooks_variables.html#variable-precedence-where-should-i-put-a-variable

Related-Bug: #1745348

This Tech-debt is introduced until the refactor of the release loading
is done.
Related-Bug: #1749978

Change-Id: I4df06c8a0d5d8133ba64c38b90cef34793776422

commit_message:
Parametrize overcloud-prep-containers script name.

Upgrading from P->Q will imply running the
overcloud-prep-containers role twice. As the
name used in the script is fix, the second
time the role will run will overwrite the
previous script file, which could be useful
for debugging purposes.

This patch adds a new parameter
'overcloud_prep_containers_script' which sets
the name of the script used to configure the
docker containers.

Change-Id: I7952872b110b25f67d66de0c5ea4610bfb0f0cb1

commit_message:
Ensure python/paths are updated if folder was not present

In the situation where a deployer may have removed the venv folder
on the target host, but has not removed the the tgz/checksum file,
the venv will get extracted, but the python/paths will not get
updated.

This patch ensures that if the venv folder was not there and gets
created by the task then it will also update the python/paths.

Change-Id: I8858e16a8c128e7d7f44c5e46dc8520aa5bc835b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

of 202 and using http_client.NO_CONTENT instead of 204

commit_message:
Fix typos in help text of Generic driver and ZFSSA config opts

Change 'the serviceinstance' to 'the service instance' in opts
 "Path to the x509 certificate used for accessing the service
 instance."

Change 'theservice instance' to 'the service instance' in opts
 "Use x509 certificates in order to authenticate to the service
 instance."

Change 'userpassword' to 'user's password' in opts
 "ZFSSA management authorized user's password."

Change-Id: I3b8f4d7e06aac1a72632e665f20fabccc23379a4
Closes-bug: #1650872
Closes-Bug: #1650875

commit_message:
Added support for managing glance images in Trove role

For hosting the database, Trove launches the nova instances
using glance image. The current Trove role does not support
this functionality.

This patch has added support for creating glance images
(for mysql, mongodb, percona db) in Trove container.

Change-Id: Iffa55dcd3c21ca5c125addef023a59ab14db2d8b
Closes-Bug: #1626730

add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

commit_message:
Exclude Ansible 2.5 from driver-reqs

Ansible 2.5 appears to be incompaible with the current
ansible driver interface. Until we've sorted it out,
we should block >=2.5.0 from being installed.

Related-Bug: #1758462

Change-Id: I9c3b2528f8da28554e3eb4e03528517a6c6c326f

commit_message:
Upgrade data on disk on mariadb major upgrade

Add an ansible task to run mysql_upgrade whenever a container
image upgrade causes a major upgrade of mariadb (e.g. 5.5 -> 10.1)

. If the overcloud was containerized prior to the major upgrade, the
  mysql upgrade job is ran in an ephemeral container (where the latest
  version of mysql comes from) and uses credentials from the Kolla
  configuration.

. Otherwise the upgrade job is run from the host (once the mysql
  rpm has been updated) and uses credentials from the host.

We log the output of the script in the journal. Also, the mysql server
needs to be started temporarily, so use a temporary log file for it
when run from the ephemeral container.

Change-Id: Id330d634ee214923407ea893fdf7a189dc477e5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/66/546666/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - step|int == 4 - name: Upgrade Mysql database on disk to newer Mysql version shell: str_replace: template: '/usr/bin/docker run -u root UPGRADE_ENV UPGRADE_VOLUMES UPGRADE_IMAGE /bin/bash -ecx "UPGRADE_SCRIPT"' params: UPGRADE_ENV: '-e "KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY=COPY_ALWAYS" -e "DB_MAX_TIMEOUT=60"' UPGRADE_IMAGE: '"{{docker_image_latest}}"' UPGRADE_VOLUMES: list_join: - ' ' - yaql: data: *mysql_volumes expression: $.data.select("-v "+$) UPGRADE_SCRIPT: list_join: - ' ' - - 'sudo -E kolla_set_configs;' - 'mysqld_safe --user=mysql --wsrep-provider=none --wsrep-on=off &' - 'timeout 60 sh -c ''while ! mysqladmin ping --silent; do sleep 1; done'';' - 'mysql_upgrade --force;' - 'mysqladmin shutdown' when: - step|int == 4 - mysql_containerized|succeeded

commit_message:
Conventional log directories for pacemaker bundles

Use /var/log/containers/<service> instead of /var/log/<service>, as
the rest of the containerized services.

Change-Id: Id5760c16260de991ff95168c76186edc113752c8
Depends-On: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556253
Change-Id: I1a236b88a8c80d82f162a92f6cdfeb9368b6eea7

commit_message:
Make HA containers log to /var/log/containers after upgrade

HA containerized services currently log under
/var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}.

Move the logging of those HA services into /var/log/containers,
like all the paunch-managed containers. Also leave a readme.txt
in the previous location to notify the change (taken from
Ic8048b25a33006a3fb5ba9bf8f20afd2de2501ee)

Only the main service log is being moved, e.g. for mysql:
  . mysqld.log now ends up in /var/log/containers/mysqld.log
  . pacemaker logs stay under /var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}

Note: some HA services don't need to be changed during upgrade:
  . cinder-{backup|volume} log under /var/log/containers/cinder
  . manila-share log under /var/log/containers/manila
  . haproxy only logs to the journal

Change-Id: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1731969
(cherry picked from commit f4a45b751b4ed66a68d65de9032fede11ed6236c)

commit_message:
Fix nit found in monasca-ui

In some part in the code we use \ for multiline formatting. In the Openstack
style guidelines they recommend to use ().
[1]: "It is preferred to wrap long lines in parentheses and not a backslash
for line continuation.".
[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/latest/user/hacking.html

Change-Id: I0c34cd9343e07aaec3bf543e9a1828db55d07246
(cherry picked from commit 5c71236b14e795867f67de938d7a6301f71fc17a)

commit_message:
Fix the nova config file location

The location of the nova config file changed after the service was
containerized. This patch fixes the location to make the Nova
NoOpFirewallDriver validation work again.

Partial-Bug: #1744322
Change-Id: I9151f68d6674b8c39168d388c902fe05f802fa83

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin to handle FQDN of compute node

The change adds simple logic to check the actual name of the compute
node. The list of nova services is filtered with FQDN hostname and if
not successful with unqualified name.

Change-Id: I9ba044f26b53a52afbac0fcd99552a4135cd4725
Story: 2001679
Task: 6785
(cherry picked from commit f3e7ff1450e1f90fdbfebff7159b41954477ef1e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/10/556410/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._nova_host = None def _get_nova_host(self, nova_client): if not self._nova_host: # Find `nova-compute` on current node services = nova_client.services.list(host=self.hostname, binary='nova-compute') if not services: # Catch the case when `nova-compute` is registered with # unqualified hostname services = nova_client.services.list( host=self.hostname.split('.')[0], binary='nova-compute') if services: self._nova_host = services[0].host self.log.info("Found 'nova-compute' registered with host: {}" .format(self._nova_host)) if self._nova_host: return self._nova_host else: self.log.warn("No 'nova-compute' service found on host: {}" .format(self.hostname)) # Return hostname as fallback value return self.hostname search_opts={'all_tenants': 1, 'host': self._get_nova_host(nova_client)})

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I3550d3e1b2c1e038d52e6ccfae132669fed077d0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add pre_upgrade_rolling_tasks

The resultin pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook will be executed in a
node-by-node rolling fashion at the beginning of major upgrade
workflow (before upgrade_steps_playbook).

The current intended use case is special handling of L3 agent upgrade
when moving Neutron services into containers. Special care needs to be
taken in this case to preserve L3 connectivity of instances (with
regard to dnsmasq and keepalived sub-processes of L3 agent).

The playbook can be run before the main upgrade like this:

openstack overcloud upgrade run --roles overcloud --playbook pre_upgrade_rolling_steps_playbook.yaml

Partial-Bug: #1738768
Change-Id: Icb830f8500bb80fd15036e88fcd314bf2c54445d
Implements: blueprint major-upgrade-workflow

added_lines: Templating webhook notifications -------------------------------- Improve the quality of notifications generated from alerts. We want notifications to be informative, concise and flexible. Kolla deployment ---------------- Add support for deploying Monasca in Docker containers using the OpenStack Kolla project. This change will support deploying Monasca in a high availability configuration. Blueprints exist for `containers`_ and the `Ansible roles`_ to deploy them. .. _containers: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla/+spec/monasca-containers .. _Ansible roles: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+spec/monasca-roles Query logs pipeline ------------------- `Add support`_ for querying ElasticSearch via the Monasca Log API to support tenant scoped access to logs. This should include accessing the logs via Grafana. .. _Add support: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/monasca/+spec/log-query-api

commit_message:
Consume ceph-container project's new style of tags

The ceph-container project is moving to a new style of tags for
Ceph. Update scenario001/004 to pull Ceph container images using
the new tags.

Change-Id: I2a6a7c5fb5148e951f85850c09be7cbb59fce0f8

commit_message:
Reload AppArmor when policies are changed

AppArmor needs to be reloaded when new policies are written, not only
when the 'aa-profile-mode' config option is changed.

Change-Id: Ia2990cdc03f6fa0d3a38e4a3247422f0950ee0eb
Closes-Bug: 1755823

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin to handle FQDN of compute node

The change adds simple logic to check the actual name of the compute
node. The list of nova services is filtered with FQDN hostname and if
not successful with unqualified name.

Change-Id: I9ba044f26b53a52afbac0fcd99552a4135cd4725
Story: 2001679
Task: 6785
(cherry picked from commit f3e7ff1450e1f90fdbfebff7159b41954477ef1e)

added_lines: self._nova_host = None def _get_nova_host(self, nova_client): if not self._nova_host: # Find `nova-compute` on current node services = nova_client.services.list(host=self.hostname, binary='nova-compute') if not services: # Catch the case when `nova-compute` is registered with # unqualified hostname services = nova_client.services.list( host=self.hostname.split('.')[0], binary='nova-compute') if services: self._nova_host = services[0].host self.log.info("Found 'nova-compute' registered with host: {}" .format(self._nova_host)) if self._nova_host: return self._nova_host else: self.log.warn("No 'nova-compute' service found on host: {}" .format(self.hostname)) # Return hostname as fallback value return self.hostname search_opts={'all_tenants': 1, 'host': self._get_nova_host(nova_client)})

commit_message:
Add python_venv_build ansible role to OSA deliverables

In OpenStack-Ansible python venvs are built, packaged
and consumed at run-time. Currently this uses the same
code across multiple roles. This role will be used by
OpenStack-Ansible to replace the duplicated code in
every OSA role but could also be used by any other
project who may wish to.

The role is registered as an independent deliverable as
it is not expected to require frequent releasing.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/553392
Change-Id: Ic4bad4c0cebe018c4a27e0cc79faf9186b7707de

commit_message:
Update G-R for oslo.concurrency>=3.26.0

The cinder project requires new parameter 'sanitize_stdout' in
method oslo_concurrency.processutils.ssh_execute that is merged
with [0] and only available in oslo.concurrency 3.26.0 or newer.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547388/

Change-Id: I4e119c4e494b6302ca698dda467a07d91d0e0630

commit_message:
resolves string formatting issue in alarm_history

string substitution fails with alarm id if self.url is
assigmed as variable. This patch replaces this var to
resolves the issue as mentioned in the bug 1758667
Closes-Bug: 1758667

Change-Id: I2e5507053940c81d3b516823078139265a1c9b30

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

We install packages twice, the -U for pip install will update requirements
to newer versions and might download even an older versions. Remove it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/554297
Change-Id: I967f10d9adb9e63fdbfd727c564f503db1aad7ca

commit_message:
Fix libvirt plugin to handle FQDN of compute node

The change adds simple logic to check the actual name of the compute
node. The list of nova services is filtered with FQDN hostname and if
not successful with unqualified name.

Change-Id: I9ba044f26b53a52afbac0fcd99552a4135cd4725
Story: 2001679
Task: 6785

added_lines: self._nova_host = None def _get_nova_host(self, nova_client): if not self._nova_host: services = nova_client.services.list(host=self.hostname, binary='nova-compute') if not services: services = nova_client.services.list( host=self.hostname.split('.')[0], binary='nova-compute') if services: self._nova_host = services[0].host if self._nova_host: return self._nova_host else: return self.hostname search_opts={'all_tenants': 1, 'host': self._get_nova_host(nova_client)})

commit_message:
Have glance notifications work like the other projects

Currently glance has a very simplistic ability to configure
notifications which seems different than nova and neutron which
both allow for selecting the topics used. In order to make glance
work like the others just have glance be configured like the other
projects notifications are being configured.

Change-Id: Ia12993e1b86d040c2705e72b32f93b874fe4adc6

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5c23fc5f4e31b461255865fb8973cc05c448e364
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use the pbr generated wsgi binary file located in binary folder

Since pbr 1.4.0, wsgi_scripts entrypoing is supported and it will
generated a wsgi compatible binary file. No need to copied it to
/var/www/cgi-bin/keystone folder.

Change-Id: If85558dcdcdf185be6171de20eed3faa8e101661

commit_message:
Add get-health action to the Ceph mon charm

* get-health - outputs `ceph health` output

Including unit and functional tests for the above actions.

Closes-Bug: #1720099

commit_message:
Set max_microversion 2.38 for nova image-metadata tests

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id35

Besides, there's inconsistency between https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#create-image-metadata
and https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id35,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554813/ will fix it.

Change-Id: Ic6cc22f048c2ccd427dfe6e6aea0273128d96592

commit_message:
Add usage with travis CI to docs

This change adds a description how to use reno within a travis CI
setup. It's neither a bug in Travis nor in reno. It's just a
different set of expectations of these two. As reno gets used
outside of OpenStack too, it makes sense to clarify the usage.

Change-Id: I675402402d5eb3d9afd374c149b21c75977946c7
Related-bug: 1703603
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/97/555697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Within Travis CI ================ The `Travis CI <https://travis-ci.org/>`_ uses shallow git clones, which prevents reno from accessing the repo data it needs. You'll see an error message like the one mentioned in `Launchpad bug 1703603 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/reno/+bug/1703603>`_. To use reno within a Travis CI job, the cloned repository needs to be unshallowed in the ``.travis.yml`` control file with the command ``git fetch --unshallow --tags``, like in this example: .. code-block:: yaml --- language: python python: - 2.7 install: - git fetch --unshallow --tags script: - reno report .

commit_message:
Fix tests for snapshots extended_snapshot_attributes policy

This fixes the Patrole test for
"volume_extension:extended_snapshot_attributes" which is
incorrectly being executed by a create test which is wrong according
to [0]. Instead, the test should be executed for
GET /snapshots/{snapshot_id} and GET /snapshots/details. Further, the
test should use soft or non-fatal authorization, which was recently
fixed in Cinder [1].

Finally, the tests should live in test_volumes_snapshots_rbac
for the same reason the policy is listed under snapshots family
of policies in cinder [0].

The expected attributes for these tests can be found here: [2].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/831665f59a0d87f2dbf7fa4f7496305977a98b0f/cinder/policies/snapshots.py#L48
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553657/1
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/831665f59a0d87f2dbf7fa4f7496305977a98b0f/cinder/api/contrib/extended_snapshot_attributes.py#L25

Change-Id: I7770148584e10a08b3e133b1793a1533f1728fc1

commit_message:
Fix invocation to get_version from microversion-parse

The version bump of microversion-parse package from 0.1.2 to 0.2.1
contains a change to the get_version call. The service_type which was
a keyword argument has now become positional (see commit #4b04aaf3).
This patch changes the invocation to make sure we adapt the version
checking behavior accordingly.

Change-Id: Ibb20204ebe9ac5998be4989050180d76475fdfb6

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-sig refs/changes/46/556346/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Please note there are no API schema available yet. This is an ongoing effort and there are several high level design decisions to be made before we are likely to move forward.The initial idea is to provide APIs with API Schema to automate generation of APIs and help the burden of manually creating SDKs. The current situation --------------------- Currently each OpenStack project under the wings of the API guides (former API ref) offers a standardized API reference model where definitions are stored in each project's repository under "api-ref/source". Those definitions are declared as RST files, .. _for example: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/flavors.inc During the publishing process, the Sphinx library loads the API definitions and generates a tree structure in memory which is used to generate the reference documentations. Proposed change --------------- A very practical approach, consists of using the Sphinx library process to dump a facto API schema in a JSON or equivalent format: .. _Sphinx adaptation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528801/under the api-guide (api-ref): __ https://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/quick-start/ The reference documentation is very handy and meant for human consumption but we would like to offer more automation capabilities.automation is needed for APIs to allow better interaction. Last PTG and Summit have shown that SDKs are struggling to keep up with the APIs in order to stay up to date. Although SDKs contributors are mostly working part time and/or are lacking resources, the main reason is likely an information entropy issue exposed by the APIs. This is why adding more automation capability will help on both side of the APIs, the producers and its consumers.as OpenAPI (Swagger), provided there is support for microversions, although thatAnother merit is to easily measure API coverage on integration tests from QA viewpoint. For example, Kubernetes provides OpenAPI spec data and with measuring tool can help its integration test: __ https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/tree/master/experiment/coverage Design Decisions ---------------- The API schema dump approach above using Sphinx libray is a very practical approach which doesn't specify API schema definition. Such definition format needs to be decided by the community in order to specify API schema standard. Basically how to define the tree structure describing in a formal way the resources provided by the REST services. There are high level decisions to be made. The overall discussion about wich specification to use for an API Schema is a complex and on going effort: __ https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Overview_of_RESTful_API_Description_Languages&section=6 Nevertheless, the Openstack community could benefit to offer better consistency in respect of HAL (HATEOAS), this has been mentioned before: __ http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/080291.html And the later is compatible with .. _OpenAPI approach: https://www.openapis.org/ which has been taken in consideration with __ https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/pull/742
deleted_lines: Please note this feature is not available yet. Once the dependent work on Sphinx library has been approved and merge, the API schema would be fully available.Provide guidance for consuming OpenStack APIs schemaunder the api-guide (api-ref): https://developer.openstack.org/api-guide/quick-start/ The reference documentation is very handy and meant for human consumption. On contrary, a formal structure would help support automation.automation is needed for APIs to allow better interaction. This requires for each API definition to be more available as an API schema. Last PTG and Summit have shown that SDKs are struggling to keep up with the APIs in order to stay up to date. Although SDKs contributors are mostly working part time and/or are lacking resources, the main reason is likely an information entropy issue exposed by the APIs. This is why adding more automation capability will help on both side of the APIs, the producers and its consumers. Definition ---------- An API schema is a tree structure describing in a formal way the resources provided by a REST service. Basically this is the same as the reference documentation but available in tree form using a JSON or YAML format. For more details please refer to https://swagger.io/specification/as OpenAPI(Swagger), provided there is support for microversions, although thatAll projects under the wings of the api-guide are already providing de-facto but informal schemas. The initial work requires to use the existing informal API schema to generate a formal tree definition. Once there then we would be able to provide proper *guideline* for consuming the API schemas. Current situation ----------------- Each OpenStack project providing an API reference guide must have API definitions stored in the project's repository under "api-ref/source". Those definitions are declared as RST files, for example: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/api-ref/source/flavors.inc During the publishing process, the sphinx library loads the API definitions and generates a tree structure in memory which is used to generate the reference documentations. Objective --------- Have the API schema generated in a format such as JSON or YAML. This can be done by saving the tree structure loaded by sphinx. Dependencies ------------ The current on-going effort requiring Sphinx adaptation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528801/

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is only
maintained by those who use it, we can set the
functional test to non-voting in order to allow
general pattern changes to be implemented
without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Change-Id: I061fcad972cef542b8c3988b5a5a178d65ce5b72

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: Ib43a06a646d1d7037651ce4fe2f82cf61fc6dd5d
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Add six as requirement

e.g. services/key_manager/json/secret_client.py
is importing six unconditionally, so it is good to
declare the dependency appropriately.

Change-Id: I62eab606546c8654bd42b47b054c0c041f60e864

commit_message:
Indicating the location tests directory in oslo_debug_helper

According to [1], we can passing a "-t" argument to
oslo_debug_helper to indicate the directory where tests
are located. This will solves ImportError exception.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslotest/features.html

Change-Id: I843af321242161d4febf8bbf4e22bd2aa0addeda

commit_message:
Add RBAC test for listing snapshots with details

This is to add a test for listing snapshots with details
which enforces policy volume:get_all_snapshots [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/831665f59a0d87f2dbf7fa4f7496305977a98b0f/cinder/policies/snapshots.py#L42

Change-Id: I081a39bb890e0937da1cad8fb612634b9c3e42a2

commit_message:
Remove conf from s3 request

The parent patch did just mechanical translation from global
CONF instance to local self.conf in the controller.

This patch tries to pull the conf from Request instance that
is actually needn't, just set some variable should be fine to us.

Change-Id: I006145f1d4d70bf3e0ba6a1d4698e75c08cd004b

commit_message:
Fix zuul check failure at legacy-zaqarclient-dsvm-functional

Zaqarclient has been affected by the new patch about dead letter metadata:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550395/
So this patch is to fix the problem.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ie993e7ec39f8f4cb4d809b46122fb479a1dffe4d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Replacing deprecated list_hosts with list_hypervisors

The compute os-hosts API is deprecated as of the 2.43 microversion,
and Hypervisors (os-hypervisors) API is recommended to list and
show host details. This is to replace deprecated usage of list_hosts
with list_hypervisors, which is a supplement of
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552434/

ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-hosts

Change-Id: Ia02c86c3e3ea658492760b461d7a0349ac69e786

commit_message:
Add team priorities for Rocky

Change-Id: I7af96192bddcf0d6a80e7129fc2affc90ce3336b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/14/551914/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | Priority | Owner | +=================================================+=======================+ | `Watcher API validation using JSON`_ | `Aditi Sharma`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Migrate to Zuulv3`_ | `Alexander Chadin`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Compute CDM include all instances`_ | `suzhengwei`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Watcher Planner Selector`_ | `Alexander Chadin`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Watcher Strategy Selector`_ | `Aditi Sharma`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Exclude project by audit scope`_ | `Aditi Sharma`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Define grammar for workload characterization`_ | `Alexander Chadin`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `JSONschema to validate efficacy indicators`_ | `Yumeng Bao`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Support Watcher HA active-active mode`_ | `Li Canwei`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Ironic notifications for bare metal DM`_ | `Yumeng Bao`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Cluster maintenance`_ | `suzhengwei`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Add name for audit in watcher dashboard`_ | `Yumeng Bao`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Add the start/end time for CONTINUOUS audit`_ | `Li Canwei`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ | `Audit scoper for baremetal data model`_ | `Yumeng Bao`_ | +-------------------------------------------------+-----------------------+ .. _Hidekazu Nakamura: https://launchpad.net/~nakamura-h .. _Alexander Chadin: https://launchpad.net/~joker946 .. _Li Canwei: https://launchpad.net/~li-canwei2 .. _Yumeng Bao: https://launchpad.net/~yumeng-bao .. _Aditi Sharma: https://launchpad.net/~adi-sky17 .. _suzhengwei: https://launchpad.net/~sue.sam Watcher API validation using JSON --------------------------------- Cureently Watcher uses different methods to validate API, which causes many bugs and few operations are possible which should not be allowed like a cloud `admin`_ can delete "ongoing" `actionplan`_ and `audit`_. To have more cleaner and same approach for all operations we should have a unified way of validating the API, which can be done using JSON. Migrate to Zuulv3 ----------------- For all of the jobs specific to a particular project, teams should move the auto-converted legacy- jobs to their own repos and rework them to stop using the legacy interfaces. There are two fundamental steps: 1. Move the jobs to your repo 2. Rework the jobs to be native v3 jobs Compute CDM include all instances --------------------------------- When building compute `CDM`_, we will exclude the instances excluded in the scope. It has terrible impact to Watcher. * To some strategies, it would get incorrectly workload of the compute nodes, because the excluded instances was not calculated in. * To server consolidation, it would disable the nodes which has excluded instances running. Proposal is to include all instances in the scope when build compute CDM. But exclude the instances excluded in the scope when migrations or simulate migrations. Watcher Planner Selector ------------------------ This component is responsible for selecting an appropriate `planner`_ for a given `strategy`_ depending on several factors (e.g list of `actions`_ used by the strategy or user request) Watcher Strategy Selector ------------------------- There may be several strategies applying for a given optimization goal. Currently , if the admin didn't specify a strategy watcher select the first strategy available in the list. If Watcher intends to be used in real infrastructure it need a more robust way to select the strategy for a given goal. The strategy selector component will enable watcher to automatically decide which strategy to use. The typical use case for this blueprint is : 1) The admin selects a goal from the set of available goals. 2) The strategy selector select the strategy which maximize the strategy "objective function" depending on several factors. 3) Once a strategy has been selected, it triggers the Watcher Optimizer (DefaultStrategyContext) with it. Exclude project by audit scope ------------------------------ As an administrator, I want to exclude instances of a specific project from Watcher optimization. This bp proposes to add exclude project feature to audit `scope`_. We need the following tasks: * Add tenant_id to Compute CDM * Add exclude project logic in audit scope Define grammar for workload characterization -------------------------------------------- As we run several workloads in a cloud, we should be able to characterize such workloads as input to watcher for ensuring Application QoS, placements and consolidation. An example of workload characterization is a weighted combination of CPU, Memory or any other resource attributes like High IOPs, Network latency etc. Replace cold migrate in migrate action to use Nova migration API ---------------------------------------------------------------- As of Now Watcher implements cold migrate in migrate action by not using Nova migration API, since Nova migration API for cold migration could not specify target host. In Queens cycle, Nova has implemented to specify target host for cold migration. JSONschema to validate efficacy indicators ------------------------------------------ In this blueprint, we will replace voplutuous with JSON-schema to validate efficacy indicator. Since in watcher we want to remove voluptuous and use JSONSchema as our only JSON validation tool to keep consistency. Support Watcher HA active-active mode ------------------------------------- Only one Decision engine can consume notification from nova and we need to get DEs synced. It can be solved by invoking method on all DEs hosts. Ironic notifications for bare metal DM -------------------------------------- Update the bare metal data model by ironic notifications Cluster maintenance ------------------- Sometimes we need to maintain compute nodes, update hardware and software, and so on. But we don't want user's application to be interrupted. This issue imports one goal and strategy for manually maintaining without user's application interruption. Add name for audit in watcher dashboard --------------------------------------- It is not easy to tell the audits apart just by uuid for end users. If we add a name for an audit, it is more friendly to end users. This bp implements adding name for an audit in watcher dashboard. Add the start/end time for CONTINUOUS audit ------------------------------------------- Currently we can only set audit execution interval, but we can not set audit start and end time. We need to increase the `audit`_ start and end time for CONTINUOUS audit. Audit scoper for baremetal data model ------------------------------------- Since baremetal data model was added, we need audit scoper for baremetal data model as compute data model has. .. _admin: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#administrator .. _actionplan: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#action-plan .. _audit: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#audit .. _CDM: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#cluster-data-model-cdm .. _planner: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#watcher-planner .. _strategy: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#strategy .. _actions: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/pike/glossary.html#action .. _scope: https://docs.openstack.org/watcher/latest/glossary.html#audit-scope

commit_message:
Unify expirer unit test task queue

To simplify unit tests for object-expirer, this patch unifies
expirer's task queue for each unit tests.
In this patch, following changes are applied:
    1: Unify expirer's task queue
    2: Remove redundant log checking, because some tests checks
       logs in their speciality
    3: Use mocked methods instead of dummy methods which
       raises specialized message exception

Change-Id: I839f0bb43eb827384727356877e33a6be7d9b81d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/48/550748/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

V3 jsonschema validation: Clusters

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Clusters API's
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/clusters/action

Change-Id: I7ba0d9fb5292d0076fc99004cf1326d7f3fc86ee

added_lines: from cinder.api.schemas import clusters as clusterfrom cinder.api import validation @validation.schema(cluster.update) disabled_reason = body.get('disabled_reason', None) name = body['name']
deleted_lines: disabled_reason = self._get_disabled_reason(body) if disabled else None name = body.get('name') if not name: raise exception.MissingRequired(element='name') def _get_disabled_reason(self, body): reason = body.get('disabled_reason') if reason: # Let wsgi handle InvalidInput exception reason = reason.strip() utils.check_string_length(reason, 'Disabled reason', min_length=1, max_length=255) return reason

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: set REST API client parameters

Communicating with the INFINIDAT InfiniBox backend is done using a
REST API through a client implemented by the infinisdk package.
This change sets the number of retries in case of an erroneous API
call and sets the User-Agent string for the client.

Change-Id: I7e94ab69e460e56ef59e33e206e9377024b213d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/21/555021/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Max retries for the REST API client in case of a failure: _API_MAX_RETRIES = 5 _INFINIDAT_CINDER_IDENTIFIER = ( "cinder/%s" % version.version_info.release_string()) def _setup_and_get_system_object(self, management_address, auth): system = infinisdk.InfiniBox(management_address, auth=auth) system.api.add_auto_retry( lambda e: isinstance( e, infinisdk.core.exceptions.APITransportFailure) and "Interrupted system call" in e.error_desc, _API_MAX_RETRIES) system.api.set_source_identifier(_INFINIDAT_CINDER_IDENTIFIER) system.login() return system self._system = ( self._setup_and_get_system_object(self.management_address, auth))

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I6aa7ffba825c9186198f691992199f51f8804823
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: ISCSI initialize_connection fixes.

Driver was not honoring the server in ISCSI and returning connection
information for all servers (IQNs) connected to a volume.

If multiple servers are mapped to a volume the driver was only returning
the first server for a given portal.

Closes-Bug: #1756914
Change-Id: If65780000fa8f59f663b00b88584cf289effa590
(cherry picked from commit 96b77e0aa62790320d16f7229aaeeb650fa875b6)

commit_message:
Remove the warning of getargspec removal

The method getargspec is deprecated and will be removed [1].
This produces a lot of deprecation warning in the logs which is
noisy. This patch proposes to use getfullargspec if it is available.
For python 2 compatibility, we need to fall back to getargspec.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ide7d9ca99e0edf23261b5d47f35766aaaac9059b

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0e081a577a9662fb8a231abf6f5b49cf239d9be8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Murano

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Heat delegates making this call
to oslo.service, so how do we switch?
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e allows services to tell
oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be called by passing a
parameter, which this patch does.

This allows Murano to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. We should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config and sending SIGHUP.

Change-Id: Ia7e405392fe67eb9c4abf2408db0fa25c5546958
Story: 2001545

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

subject: Add thin check in consume_from_volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-12 11:25:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/b6cce113beb12367ed11f5b29ae8e06cda0ab798', 'message': 'Use utils.calculate_virtual_free_capacity in capacity_filter

The calculation of adjusted_free_virtual in CapacityFilter is right,
but there is a problem in the time of using [consume_from_volume] of
class BackendState in cinder.scheduler.host_manager when doing creating.

The free_capacity_gb of backend_state will reduce every time even if
the volume is thin. But actually, the thin volume will not use capacity
at the moment of creating. The free_capacity_gb will update after the
periodic task of _report_driver_status, but the creating problem is
happened just in this time interval.

This patch fix it just keeping the same with CapacityWeigher.

Change-Id: I554dc3db918bb9a72a9a3ef17338186735b5b6f2
Closes-Bug: 1755143
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-19 09:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/de813ef3d50f1dad31c3f5f6e6f096b94e3a47e7', 'message': "Add thin check in consume_from_volume

The free_capacity_gb of backend_state will reduce every time even if
the volume is thin. But actually, the thin volume will not use capacity
at the moment of creating. The free_capacity_gb will update after the
periodic task of _report_driver_status, but the creating problem is
happened just in this time interval.

This path add a thin check when consuming from volume:
We will reduce the free capacity in these two cases:
1. The 'provisioning:type' is 'thick' in extra_specs of volume type.
2. Case 1 is false, and only if the backend don't support thin provisioning.

Change-Id: I554dc3db918bb9a72a9a3ef17338186735b5b6f2
Closes-Bug: 1755143
"}]
commit_message:
Add thin check in consume_from_volume

The free_capacity_gb of backend_state will reduce every time even if
the volume is thin. But actually, the thin volume will not use capacity
at the moment of creating. The free_capacity_gb will update after the
periodic task of _report_driver_status, but the creating problem is
happened just in this time interval.

This path add a thin check when consuming from volume:
We will reduce the free capacity in these two cases:
1. The 'provisioning:type' is 'thick' in extra_specs of volume type.
2. Case 1 is false, and only if the backend don't support thin provisioning.

Change-Id: I554dc3db918bb9a72a9a3ef17338186735b5b6f2
Closes-Bug: 1755143
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/69/551969/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
install sudo in the devuser element

The devuser element can set up passwordless sudo, which requiers the
/etc/sudoers.d directory, which requires the sudo package, so we ensure
the sudo package is installed.

Change-Id: I80d6c669d4ac0d97b49d01cb621bf05b8e7f8ef1

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id6c04604ad9f51aadd233f21f99ddce21c3d8980
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Drop non-existent verbose option

The ``verbose`` option has been deprecated for a long time and no longer
exists in the config. So do not set it for our agent.

Change-Id: Ief48c4d1185f2edf35152b92b2ba18339c34da47

commit_message:
Bump tenacity to 4.4.0

Tenacity 4.4.0 has some new usefull features like wait_random_exponential
which is usefull for minimising retry collisions, and will be usefull
for some openstack projects such as vmware_nsxlib

Change-Id: I4f3bde8183140ddc70de2e3d17e203e3a7fbc648

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: Ic4d6892118bcc3648656b50c918060631bfd1588

commit_message:
Archive ARA report on successful jobs

This patch ensures that the ARA reports are run on successful jobs
but the results are put into a tarball. This should allow quicker
access to ARA reports without consuming lots of inodes on OpenStack's
CI infrastructure.

Change-Id: I68da890578c98a60e321d8e112a04980e01560a1
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/62/550962/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # To avoid consuming lots of inodes in OpenStack's CI infra, we tar up # the ARA report when we have a successful job. ${ARA_CMD} generate html "${GATE_LOG_DIR}/ara/" || true pushd $GATE_LOG_DIR tar cvf ara-report.tar ara/ rm -rf ara/* mv ara-report.tar ara/ popd
deleted_lines: # In order to reduce the quantity of unnecessary log content # being kept in OpenStack-Infra we only generate the ARA report # when the test result is a failure. echo "Generating ARA report due to non-zero exit code (${TEST_EXIT_CODE})." ${ARA_CMD} generate html "${GATE_LOG_DIR}/ara" || true else echo "Not generating ARA report due to test pass."

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: Ie8f7c57b9aac629ae2dbdccec3e554633a768ce6

commit_message:
Gracefully handle OS_TENANT_NAME

If OS_TENANT_NAME is not defined but OS_PROJECT_NAME is defined, quietly
set OS_TENANT_NAME=OS_PROJECT_NAME as to not just fail. Since quickstart
relies on os_tenant_name all over the place but the newer clouds are
Keystone v3 which does not require os_tenant_name, let's not have the
reproducer just fail if we can gracefully continue.

Change-Id: Ie508c7a9723f6eca3616c9b6b5b6795582a8c121
Related-Bug: #1750455
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/55/547155/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(aschultz): work around for LP#1750455 if [[ -v OS_PROJECT_NAME ]]; then OS_TENANT_NAME=$OS_PROJECT_NAME else echo "Tenant credentials are not sourced." exit 1; fi
deleted_lines: echo "Tenant credentials are not sourced." exit 1;

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Icc7b5a39ef7e29f25ebfe8a10a4b8edba115505a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Update systemd service for longer TimeoutStopSec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-23 18:09:18.000000000', 'files': ['templates/octavia-systemd-init.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia/commit/b86823c0c3d9f3b5ed744eeed50c4c50b849d672', 'message': 'Update systemd service for longer TimeoutStopSec

This patch updates the default systemd service definition for the Octavia
processes. It increases the TimeoutStopSec to 300 seconds to allow more time
for the in-flight flows (failover, etc.) to finish and gracefully shutdown.
If the cloud has performance issues, flows may run beyond their normal
sub-minute runtime.

Change-Id: I5708c05db2c9f13491f5af0cd0b8c5632c537608
(cherry picked from commit b1d02c6ba90dbeed2e564afcf886f29b8b37e51c)

commit_message:
Update systemd service for longer TimeoutStopSec

This patch updates the default systemd service definition for the Octavia
processes. It increases the TimeoutStopSec to 300 seconds to allow more time
for the in-flight flows (failover, etc.) to finish and gracefully shutdown.
If the cloud has performance issues, flows may run beyond their normal
sub-minute runtime.

Change-Id: I5708c05db2c9f13491f5af0cd0b8c5632c537608
(cherry picked from commit b1d02c6ba90dbeed2e564afcf886f29b8b37e51c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia refs/changes/96/555896/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TimeoutStartSec=120 # Give extra time for shutdown to allow flows to finish (failover, etc.) # This timer expiring early can lead to load balancers stuck in PENDING_* # states as the flows were interrupted before completing. # This setting depends on the performance of your cloud. TimeoutStopSec=300

commit_message:
Make unstable functional test non-voting

Given that the functional build for this repo
rarely passes and the repo itself is currently
unused, we can set the functional test to
non-voting in order to allow general pattern
changes to be implemented without delay.

This does mean that reviewers applying functional
changes will have to be disciplined about checking
the results, but I think that is OK in this case.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556253
Change-Id: I3f795e59f1b58862f2f196b2ac06d9891c3a17fa

subject: Make HA containers log to /var/log/containers after upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-15 14:54:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/c9e9a952b03dabbc7552102253953b74c8481183', 'message': "Make HA containers log to /var/log/containers after upgrade

Many HA containerized HA services currently log under
/var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}.

Move the logging of those HA services into /var/log/containers,
like all the paunch-managed containers.

Only the main service log is being moved, e.g. for mysql:
  . mysqld.log now ends up in /var/log/containers/mysqld.log
  . pacemaker logs stay under /var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}

Note: some HA services don't need to be changed during upgrade:
  . cinder-{backup|volume} log under /var/log/containers/cinder
  . manila-share log under /var/log/containers/manila
  . haproxy only logs to the journal

Change-Id: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Related-Bug: #1756106

Change-Id: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1731969
"}]
commit_message:
Make HA containers log to /var/log/containers after upgrade

HA containerized services currently log under
/var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}.

Move the logging of those HA services into /var/log/containers,
like all the paunch-managed containers. Also leave a readme.txt
in the previous location to notify the change (taken from
Ic8048b25a33006a3fb5ba9bf8f20afd2de2501ee)

Only the main service log is being moved, e.g. for mysql:
  . mysqld.log now ends up in /var/log/containers/mysqld.log
  . pacemaker logs stay under /var/log/pacemaker/bundles/{service-replica}

Note: some HA services don't need to be changed during upgrade:
  . cinder-{backup|volume} log under /var/log/containers/cinder
  . manila-share log under /var/log/containers/manila
  . haproxy only logs to the journal

Change-Id: Icb311984104eac16cd391d75613517f62ccf6696
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Partial-Bug: #1731969

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib89fed1004a5e4f7a0234fdccf6b8e1d85f3eee0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Drop mox3 from test-requirements.txt

because this creates a stub using mox.

This is part of mox-removal community goal in Rocky.

commit_message:
Use microversion parse 0.2.1

That change extracts much of the microversion handling code from
placement and uses code from the microversion-parse library instead.
The code in microversion-parse was taken from placement and lightly
adjusted to make it more generally useful.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555332
Change-Id: I5a70ebf2843d2b50dccb44e66d50e1e5105005f4

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I530d7fced04c8e6668e92ed5feb78ae3a863979c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Drop mox usage from VPNaaS panel tests

AddEndpointGroup workflow previously passes 'subnets' and 'cidrs'
in "context" data to endpointgroup_create(), but precisely speaking
this is not correct (even though endpointgroup_create() does filtering
inside the function). After mock introduction, arguments are checked
more stricly and it is tricky to have 'subnets' and 'cidrs' in
assert_called_once_with, so this commit changes the arguments in
the AddEndpointGroup workflow.

This is part of mox-removal community goal in Rocky.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I673d98410d124d082272a7ba23836eb2e818f3e9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Execute cinder_backends on the last API server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-24 19:30:55.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder/commit/948305aa6bfeeb2abdda7351aa0a8ff292810e56', 'message': 'Execute cinder_backends on the last API server

Currently the backend setup executes on the first cinder-api
host. The playbook to execute the setup of the API is done
in serial. This creates a bit of a problem on a greenfield
deployment which uses haproxy because the backend is disabled
and there are no other API hosts setup yet. This makes the
CLI commands which require the API to be working fail.

This patch makes the backend create task set execute on the
last cinder-api host. This means that when they execute, there
should already be other API services up and therefore the load
balancer will be able to handle the API requests.

Closes-Bug: #1753125
Change-Id: I335b9f4ef0566d1561275059b90e0a50d16c4992
(cherry picked from commit 76e0e8cfa0ac63d4aa5df1e135999b8488d04e0d)
'}]
commit_message:
Execute cinder_backends on the last API server

Currently the backend setup executes on the first cinder-api
host. The playbook to execute the setup of the API is done
in serial. This creates a bit of a problem on a greenfield
deployment which uses haproxy because the backend is disabled
and there are no other API hosts setup yet. This makes the
CLI commands which require the API to be working fail.

This patch makes the backend create task set execute on the
last cinder-api host. This means that when they execute, there
should already be other API services up and therefore the load
balancer will be able to handle the API requests.

Closes-Bug: #1753125
Change-Id: I335b9f4ef0566d1561275059b90e0a50d16c4992
(cherry picked from commit 76e0e8cfa0ac63d4aa5df1e135999b8488d04e0d)

commit_message:
Revert "Ensure the /etc/pki/rpm-gpg directory exists"

This task ended up being unnecessary.
The actual problem was fixed in
Ide9993eb67bfa7d3822714839aa1fc24a8b17fb3.

This reverts commit 1433976334b4e9006559406fc1ea02d78429e90d.

Change-Id: Ifbf791eaf57a4f89127d4835ff82fbb3c472c52b

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: I11d4af5807a2f95dd6e6d06ae5c5f9a9ea45e2f9

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Add common python_venv_build role

In order to allow tests to work as the use of the common
role is implemented in the various roles, we pre-implement
the addition of the role into the a-r-r file.

Change-Id: I96a4bff650aa50ba7e388bb34084524543c08a8f
Implements: blueprint python-build-install-simplification
Signed-off-by: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
